Identification.LongTitle: An Act to implement certain provisions of the budget tabled in Parliament on April 21, 2015 and other measures

Provision.Text: Her Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate and House of Commons of Canada, enacts as follows:

Section.Text: This Act may be cited as the Economic Action Plan 2015 Act, No. 1.

Heading.Label: PART 1
Heading.TitleText: Amendments to the Income Tax Act and to Related Legislation

TitleText.XRefExternal: Insurable Earnings and Collection of Premiums Regulations

Heading.TitleText: Related Amendments to the Children’s Special Allowances Act

Section.Text: This Division comes into force, or is deemed to have come into force, on July 1, 2015.
The Federal Balanced Budget Act, whose text is as follows and whose schedule is set out in Schedule 1 to this Act, is enacted:
The Prevention of Terrorist Travel Act is enacted as follows:

Heading.TitleText: Related Amendment to the Canada Evidence Act

Text.Repealed: [Repealed before coming into force, 2017, c. 6, s. 136]
[Repealed before coming into force, 2017, c. 6, s. 136]
[Repealed before coming into force, 2015, c. 36, s. 70]
[Repealed before coming into force, 2018, c. 27, s. 239]

Section.MarginalNote: Order in council — Industrial Design Act

Subsection.Text: Sections 44, 45 and 47 to 49 come into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council, but that day must not be before the day on which sections 102 to 113 of the Economic Action Plan 2014 Act, No. 2 come into force.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Sections 44, 45 and 47 to 49 in force November 5, 2018, see SI/2018-45.]

Subsection.Text: Sections 50 to 53, 55 to 62, 64 and 65 come into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council, but that day must not be before the day on which sections 114 to 141 of the Economic Action Plan 2014 Act, No. 2 come into force.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Sections 50 to 53, 56 to 62, 64 and 65 in force October 30, 2019, see SI/2019-46.]

Subsection.Text: Section 67 and subsection 69(2) come into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council, but that day must not be before the day on which section 357 of the Economic Action Plan 2014 Act, No. 1 comes into force.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Section 67 in force June 17, 2019, see SI/2018-100; subsection 69(2) repealed before coming into force, see 2018, c. 27, s. 239.]

Subsection.Text: Sections 46, 63 and 68 come into force on a day or days to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Section 46 in force November 5, 2018, see SI/2018-45; sections 63 and 68 in force November 5, 2018, see SI/2018-49.]

Subsection.Text: Sections 54 and 66 come into force 12 months after the day on which this Act receives royal assent.
Subsection 69(1) comes into force on the first day on which both section 359 of the Economic Action Plan 2014 Act, No. 1 and section 68 are in force.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Subsection 69(1) repealed before coming into force, see 2015, c. 36, s. 70.]

Section.Text: This Division comes into force on January 3, 2016.
This Division comes into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Division 6 in force May 18, 2017, see SI/2017-27.]

Section.Text: The provisions of this Division come into force on a day or days to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Section 87 in force September 14, 2015, see SI/2015-78; sections 88 to 92 in force September 1, 2020, see SI/2020-49.]

TitleText.XRefExternal: Members of Parliament Retiring Allowances Act
Garnishment, Attachment and Pension Diversion Act
Parliamentary Employment and Staff Relations Act
Modernization of Benefits and Obligations Act
Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act
Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act

Subsection.Text: Sections 168 and 170, subsection 171(2) and section 174 come into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Sections 168 and 170, subsection 171(2) and section 174 in force July 31, 2018, see SI/2018-47.]

Subsection.Text: Subsections 169(1) and (2) and 171(1) and (3) and sections 172, 173 and 175 come into force on a day or days to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Subsections 169(1) and 171(1) and (3) and sections 172, 173 and 175 in force October 18, 2017, see SI/2017-58.]

Section.Text: The provisions of this Division come into force on a day or days to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Sections 177 to 204 in force April 1, 2016, see SI/2016-14.]

TitleText.XRefExternal: Canadian Forces Members and Veterans Re-establishment and Compensation Act

Heading.TitleText: Consequential Amendments to the Veterans Review and Appeal Board Act

Section.Text: This Division comes into force, or is deemed to have come into force, on July 1, 2015.
